channel.title: New local problems on FixMyStreet
channel.description: The latest local problems reported by users

item.title: Rats in Cator park, near play ground., 16th January
item.description:
2 rats seen crossing path towards playground by bridge across the Beck in Cator Park, Beckenham.

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Bailes Place, New Beckenham, Greater London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: This car has been in the same spot for several weeks and looks abandonded, 16th January
item.description:
Several neighbours have raised concerns over an abandoned car (in a sorry state) that has not moved from this position in weeks. We don't recognise the car as belonging to any of the neighbours. It appears to be taxed, but it hasn't moved.

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Old Road, Crayford, Greater London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Walkway between carronade place and temple close, 16th January
item.description:
Rubbish broken plastics was being dumped along walkway but pile is now between carronade place and temple close on carronade side and people are dumping full black bags as well as other unwanted items. Also green areas are being used to dump rubbish now at the cross junction of temple close. The area is beginning to look scruffy and run down
Nearest address to the pin placed on the map (from OS Places API): Temple Close, Thamesmead
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Bins not collected for the 4th week in a row, 16th January
item.description:
This is has been an ongoing problem. The bins haven’t been collected since before Christmas and with every week passing the bins are more and more overflowing. Can this please get fixed asap?

Nearest address to the pin placed on the map (from OS Places API): Gould Terrace, Hackney, London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Fly tipping - with address visible, 16th January
item.description:
Hi, fly-tipping is very common in this area. i noticed this pile of rubbish has an easily visible home address, presumably of the culprit. I thought your enforcement colleagues might like to follow this up and see if at least one person can be persuaded.

Nearest address to the pin placed on the map (from OS Places API): Amhurst Park, Hackney, London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Fly tipping obstructing foot path, 16th January
item.description:
Flytipping at the beginning of Sultan street. Fridge, cupboard etc has been left over night and it is obstructing the footpath. I am disabled and nearly had an accident, so this is a problem. Please clear asap and please put up a NO FLY TIPPING sign. A camera would also be welcome to stop this. Thank you so much
Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Sultan Street, Elmers End, Greater London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Lock broken on Cycle Hangar 2122, 16th January
item.description:
Arrived to hangar and door was open / hangar was unlocked. Tried to use my key to lock it but it wouldn't work. Seems like malfunction rather than theft as there were 2 bikes in there, not stolen
Nearest address to the pin placed on the map (from OS Places API): Blurton Road, Hackney, London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: The Midyeci drilling and sawing on public footpath, 16th January
item.description:
Hi there, The business The Midyeci at 505 Kingsland Road is currently doing renovations. Using hand held buzz saw on the footpath to cut stone creating a public health risk for people passing by as they inhale particles. It is out the front of a bus stop
Nearest address to the pin placed on the map (from OS Places API): Kingsland Road, Hackney, London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Damage to low level lighting cables in Tranton Road, 16th January
item.description:
Carrying out Gas service replacement work in Tranton Road SE16 the electric cables were damaged by our team with the road breaker whilst breaking out the tarmac and concrete, these have been checked by UKPN and they confirm they are safe as the fuse has tripped out but are not UKPN responsibility but are Local Authorities.
Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): 17, Tranton Road, Bermondsey, Greater London
Report on FixMyStreet
